channel.title: IMC OnAir ... IMC - India meets Classic presents ...
channel.description: Edition as Radio Broadcasting Show and PodCasting for Indian Classical Music (Raga CDs, Specials (e.g. Festival Reports), live performances ("night of ragas"))
channel.category: inter cultural dialogue, music education, music therapy, promotion initiative

item.title: Some Examples for Listening / Hoerbeispiele ... indische Musiktitel (Raga CDs)
item.author: Lothar J.R. Maier (Initiator / Owner / Editor Leadership - promotion initiative IMC - India meets Classic)
item.description:
.. IMC presented RAGA CDs at its monthly broadcasting shows:
on 28th Nov 2005 - piloting: Sur Taal (details see archive),
on 27th March 2006 - spring ragas ... (regular start of monthly broadcasting)
on 24th April 2006  - (early) morning ragas (part 1: playtime 03:00-06:00 a.m.)

coming next on 22nd May 2006 - morning ragas (part 2: playtime 06:00-09:00 a.m.) ...

 

 

CD-Track 1: Essence of Rythm (Raga: Jhinjoti ; Teental (5 beats); time: 22:00 min.),  CD-Track 1, 2 and 3 :Sur Taal.

 

further ...

 

CD-Track 6 :Shaadi Ki Shehnaiyan - Vol. 1, CD-Track 1 :The Doyen of Hindustan Music, CD-Track 1 :ThoughtN Beats, CD-Track 1 :Shehnai Legend -Ustad Bismillah Khan and Party, CD-Track 1: Call of the Valley, CD Track 1: Flute Fantasia, CD Track 2: Raga Classical Instrumental Flute and CD-Track 1 :West meets East (= IMCs Jingle Sound).

 

Raga Jhinjoti: The beauty of this melodious raga lies in its simplicity. It utilizes all the notes and use komal Ni*.This is a supportive raga of the Thaat Khamaj*. Elaboration of this raga is normally restricted to the lower and middle octave. The play time is the second quarter of the night.

Aroha (= ascending scala): SaReGaMa Pa Dha Ni Sa;
Avaroha (= descending scala): SaNiDhaPa MaGaReSa

*)  ... Thaat consists of the seven notes (SA, Re, Ga, Ma, Pa, Dha, Ni) and is designated by the change of shuddha (naturally played), komal (softly played) and teevra (hard played).

++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++

 

 ENGLISH LANGUAGE ...

|~~~~~~~~~~~~~N~~O~~T~~I~~C~~E~~-~~L~~I~~C~~E~~N~~C~~E~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~|

MARWA Thaat the source of all ragas (Pkt. 10/2000)

- Khyal in Vilambit Ektal,

- Khyal in Drut Teental

- Khyal in Drut Teental & Ektal

 

Balkrishna Lyer (Tabla), Purshottam Walawalkar (Haromonium)
